name: Maine Coon

crossbreed_info.breeding_purpose: Create domestic cat with wild appearance

inheritance_patterns.coat_from: Primary parent (spotted pattern from Asian Leopard Cat)
health_considerations: Hybrid sterility in early generations (F1-F3 males)

recognition_challenges: Some organizations don't recognize wild hybrid crosses
Requires multiple generations to achieve recognition

history: The Maine Coon originated in the US state of Maine. It is one of the oldest natural breeds in North America and is known for its size, intelligence, and sociable nature.

appearance.colors: Various (brown tabby, black, white, blue, red, etc.)

temperament.summary: Gentle, playful, intelligent, and social. Good with children and other pets.

care.grooming: Brush 2-3 times per week (more during shedding seasons)
care.exercise: Provide daily play (Maine Coons are active and enjoy interactive toys)
care.nutrition: High-protein diet; monitor portions to prevent obesity

health.vaccinations: Core vaccines (FVRCP, rabies) per vet schedule; FeLV vaccine if at risk

common_medications.name: Broad-Spectrum Dewormer
common_medications.usage_notes: Administer every 3 months or as advised by a veterinarian

common_medications.name: Heartworm Preventative
common_medications.usage_notes: Give monthly (oral chewable) in heartworm-endemic areas

common_medications.name: Joint Supplement
common_medications.purpose: Supports joint health (for large breeds prone to hip issues)
common_medications.usage_notes: Mix with food daily, as recommended by the vet

veterinary_care_recommendations.deworming_schedule: Every 3 months for adults (more frequently for kittens)
veterinary_care_recommendations.vaccinations: Annual core vaccines (FVRCP, rabies); FeLV vaccination if outdoor
veterinary_care_recommendations.dental_care: Brush teeth weekly; consider annual professional dental cleaning
veterinary_care_recommendations.parasite_prevention: Year-round flea, tick, and heartworm prevention is advised
veterinary_care_recommendations.special_screenings: Cardiac ultrasound after age 3-4 to screen for HCM (breed predisposition)

genetic_precautions: Perform DNA tests for HCM and SMA genes before breeding
Avoid close inbreeding to maintain genetic diversity
Ensure parents have healthy hips to reduce risk of dysplasia in kittens

other_traits: Known as the 'gentle giants' of the cat world; often enjoy water and have a soft chirping voice
fun_facts: The Maine Coon is one of the largest domesticated cat breeds.
Known as 'gentle giants' due to their size and friendly nature.
